intro: Galium corsicum var. soleirolii, commonly known as Corsican bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Corsica. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in sunny, dry habitats such as rocky slopes and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family.
